01EarlyCulturalWritings.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
01EarlyCulturalWritings.pdf.description: An extensive account of spiritual experiences and teachings by Sri Aurobindo.

02CollectedPoems.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
02CollectedPoems.pdf.description: An extensive account of spiritual experiences and teachings by Sri Aurobindo.

03-04CollectedPlaysAndStories.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
03-04CollectedPlaysAndStories.pdf.description: An extensive account of spiritual experiences and teachings by Sri Aurobindo.

05Translations.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
05Translations.pdf.description: Translations comprises all of Sri Aurobindo’s translations from Sanskrit, Bengali, Tamil, Greek and Latin into English, with the exception of his translations of Vedic and Upanishadic literature.

06-07BandeMataram.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
06-07BandeMataram.pdf.description: These volumes include Sri Aurobindo’s surviving political writ- ings and speeches from the years 1890 to 1908.

08Karmayogin.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
08Karmayogin.pdf.description: Sri Aurobindo launched the Karmayogin, “A Weekly Review of National Religion, Literature, Science, Philosophy, &c.,” on 19 June 1909, six weeks after his release from jail on conclusion of the Alipore Bomb Trial

09WritingsInBengaliAndSanskrit.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
09WritingsInBengaliAndSanskrit.pdf.description: Writings in Bengali and Sanskrit comprises prose and poetry written by Sri Aurobindo in Bengali and a much smaller body of writing in Sanskrit.

10-11RecordOfYoga.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
10-11RecordOfYoga.pdf.description: Record of Yoga is a diary of Sri Aurobindo’s yoga between 1909 and 1927. He kept it fairly regularly from 1912 to 1920, and also wrote a few entries in 1909, 1911 and 1927.

12EssaysDivineAndHuman.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
12EssaysDivineAndHuman.pdf.description: Essays Divine and Human consists of short prose pieces written by Sri Aurobindo after his arrival in Pondicherry in 1910

13EssaysInPhilosophyAndYoga.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
13EssaysInPhilosophyAndYoga.pdf.description: Essays in Philosophy and Yoga consists of short works in prose written by Sri Aurobindo between 1909 and 1950 and published during his lifetime. All but a few of them are concerned with aspects of spiritual philosophy, yoga, and related subjects

14VedicAndPhilologicalStudies.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
14VedicAndPhilologicalStudies.pdf.description: Vedic and Philological Studies comprises writings on the Veda, translations of and commentaries on Vedic hymns to gods other than Agni, notes on the Veda, and essays and notes on philology.

15TheSecretOfTheVeda.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
15TheSecretOfTheVeda.pdf.description: This volume comprises Sri Aurobindo’s writings on and transla- tions of the Rig Veda that were published in the monthly review Arya between 1914 and 1920.

16HymnsToTheMysticFire.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
16HymnsToTheMysticFire.pdf.description: The present volume comprises Sri Aurobindo’s translations of and commentaries on hymns to Agni in the Rig Veda.

17IshaUpanishad.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
17IshaUpanishad.pdf.description: This volume contains Sri Aurobindo’s translations of and commentaries on the Isha Upanishad.

18KenaAndOtherUpanishads.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
18KenaAndOtherUpanishads.pdf.description: This volume comprises Sri Aurobindo’s translations of and com- mentaries on Upanishads other than the Isha Upanishad.

19EssaysOnTheGita.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
19EssaysOnTheGita.pdf.description: The first series of Essays on the Gita appeared in the monthly review Arya between August 1916 and July 1918. It was revised by Sri Aurobindo and published as a book in 1922.

20TheRenaissanceInIndia.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
20TheRenaissanceInIndia.pdf.description: Most of the essays that make up this volume have appeared until now under the title The Foundations of Indian Culture.

21-22TheLifeDivine.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
21-22TheLifeDivine.pdf.description: The Life Divine first appeared serially in the monthly review Arya between August 1914 and January 1919. Each instalment was written immediately before its publication. In 1939 and 1940 Sri Aurobindo revised The Life Divine for book publication.

23-24TheSynthesisOfYoga.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
23-24TheSynthesisOfYoga.pdf.description: The Synthesis of Yoga first appeared serially in the monthly review Arya between August 1914 and January 1921. Each instalment was written immediately before its publication.

30LettersOnYoga-III.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
30LettersOnYoga-III.pdf.description: Experiences and Realisations in the Integral Yoga

31LettersOnYoga-IV.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
31LettersOnYoga-IV.pdf.description: Transformation of Human Nature in the Integral Yoga

32TheMotherWithLettersOnTheMother.pdf.book_title: The Mother With Letters On The Mother
32TheMotherWithLettersOnTheMother.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
32TheMotherWithLettersOnTheMother.pdf.description: This volume consists of two different but related works of Sri Aurobindo: The Mother and Letters on the Mother.

33-34Savitri.pdf.author: Sri Aurobindo
33-34Savitri.pdf.description: The writing of Savitri extended over much of the later part of Sri Aurobindo’s life.
